cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly turning northwest overnight, then northward across Louisiana into the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City/Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas including metropolitan New Orleans, Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast of Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (40-65 mph) with higher gusts possible; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible along lower Mississippi River and Lake Pontchartrain, affecting wharves upriver toward the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts could trigger significant river and flash flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands; prolonged high river stages hindering navigation and cargo operations.
